intro: Erigeron gulielmi, commonly known as the William's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has silvery-gray foliage and produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer. Erigeron gulielmi is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
